thread.title: College hockey: UMass storms back to tie New Hampshire
thread.title_full: College hockey: UMass storms back to tie New Hampshire | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: College hockey: UMass storms back to tie New Hampshire
text:
College hockey: UMass storms back to tie New Hampshire Herald Staff Saturday, October 24, 2015 comments Tweet The UMass men’s hockey team stormed back from a five-goal deficit late in the second period to draw even with New Hampshire, 6-6, in a Hockey East opener last night in Amherst.
Ray Pigozzi started the comeback with a goal in the final minutes of the second period. In the third period, Anthony Petrella, Dennis Kravchenko, Shane Walsh and Dominic Trento all scored for the Minutemen (3-0-1).
Ryan Badger also scored for UMass, in the first period.
Dan Correale had a hat trick for the Wildcats (1-2-1), and the other goals came from Collin MacDonald, Andrew Poturalski and Chris Miller.
BC 3, Colorado College 0 — In Colorado Springs, Ryan Fitzgerald opened the scoring in the second period and tallied again in the third, and Zach Sanford got the final goal, as Thatcher Demko and the Eagles (3-1-0) shut out the Tigers (0-5-0).
Minnesota 4, Northeastern 0 — In Minneapolis, Ryan Ruck stopped 21-of-22 shots, but Derick Roy had already allowed three goals on four shots in the opening 11:50, and the Huskies (1-3-0) lost to the Golden Gophers (1-3-0).
UMass-Lowell 1, Merrimack 1 — In North Andover, C. J. Smith scored in the first period for the River Hawks (3-0-1, 0-0-1 Hockey East) and Ben Bahe answered in the second as the Warriors (2-0-1, 0-0-1) forged the tie.
Canisius 4, Holy Cross 3 — In Buffalo, Mike Barrett, Mike Laffin and Brett Mulcahy scored, but the winless Crusaders (0-4-0, 0-1-0 Atlantic) fell to the Golden Griffins (1-2-0, 1-0-0).
Penn St. 8, AIC 3 — In State College, Pa., Lucas Bombardier, Chris Porter and Johno May had third-period goals, but the Yellow Jackets (0-4-0) fell prey to the Nittany Lions (3-1-0).
Providence 2, Ohio St. 1 — The Friars (3-0-1) edged the visiting Buckeyes (0-5-0) behind Nick Ellis’ 26 saves and goals from Tom Parisi and Anthony Florentino, who also had an assist.
N. Dakota 2, Vermont 0 — In Burlington, Vt., Mike Santaguida’s 39 stops weren’t enough to keep the Catamounts (1-3-0) from being shut out by UND (3-0-2).
Women
Dartmouth 2, Harvard 1 — In Hanover, N.H., Lindsey Allen had a goal and set up Kennedy Ottenbreit’s tally for the Big Green (1-0-0, 1-0-0 ECAC) in a win against the Crimson (0-1-0, 0-1-0).
BC 4, Cornell 1 — In Ithaca, N.Y., the Eagles (7-0-0) used three third-period goals, including Alex Carpenter’s second into an empty net, to beat the Big Red (0-1-0).
